text.p: These are the leading stories in the Turkish press on Monday. Reuters has not verified these stories and does not vouch for their accuracy.
- Tens of thousands visited the Ataturk masoluem in Ankara on the 58th anniversary of Turkey's founder's death on Sunday.
- The Islamist mayor of Kayseri province has been critised for saying he unwillingly attendeded ceremonies commemorating Ataturk's death.
- Parliament spokesman Mustafa Kalemli says parliament is under pressure from people demanding an end to corruption.
- The Islamist-led government cannot fulfil its promises of swift privatisation as the ruling coalition is still squabbling over who should have the authority over sell-offs.
- Indications increase that wanted organised crime boss Abdullah Catli -- who died in a traffic accident alongside a senior police chief last week -- was protected by the police force.
- Turkey has failed to pass harmonization regulations related to a customs deal with the European Union one year after the agreement was signed.
- Health ministry statistics reveals that half the Turkish population has health problems.
- Record attendence for the Istanbul Book Fair in its fifteenth year.
